    • Method Detail

      • pow

        public static double pow(double value,
                         double exp)
        Method calculates first value raised to the power of second value. Gives approx (0.0001 error) correct answers bellow numbers like 2^33. If value is bellow zero and exponent is not an integer, result id NaN In general form a^b is a^c * a^n/m, where c is integer part of exponent and n/m is fractal representation of remaining. a^c * a^n/m is same as a^c * (m:th root of a)^n
        Parameters:
        value - base
        exp - exponent
        Returns:
        value base to the power of exponent

      • pow

        public static double pow(double value,
                         int exp)
        Method calculates first value raised to the power of second value. Gives approx (0.0001 error) correct answers bellow numbers like 13^13. TODO: Better accuracy
        Parameters:
        value - base
        exp - exponent
        Returns:
        value base to the power of exponent

      • sqrt

        public static double sqrt(double value)
        Return square root of given value. This is done by . Newton's iterative method This implementation is a bit slower, but talking about tenth or hundredth of millisecond.
        Parameters:
        value - value to calculate square root for
        Returns:
        square root value, or NaN if value is negative

        public static int round(double value)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        rounded value

      • findMinimumBoundingBox

        public static Point[] findMinimumBoundingBox(MyArrayList<Point> points)
        Returns corner points for minimum bounding box for given set of points.
        Parameters:
        points -
        Returns:
        Array of points in clockwise order, that is: top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left

      • moveCoordinatesToOrigin

        public static MyArrayList<Point> moveCoordinatesToOrigin(MyArrayList<Point> points)
        Returns list of points which minimum bounding box is moved to origin. This is done calculating first minimum bounding box for given list of points and the calculating the delta of x and y coordinates. Origin is assumed to be top left, so the calculated bounding box's top left point is mapped to point (0,0).
        Parameters:
        points - list of points to shift
        Returns:
        new list of given points shifted

      • scaleCoordinates

        public static MyArrayList<Point> scaleCoordinates(int width,
                                                  int height,
                                                  MyArrayList<Point> points)
        Returns a new list of points scaled to given width and height. That is the points are scaled to fill the given width and height matrix.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -
        points -
        Returns:

      • getMaxAndMinValues

        public static double[] getMaxAndMinValues(MyArrayList<Point> points)
        Returns max and min weights from given list of points.
        Parameters:
        points - list of points
        Returns:
        an array as [min, max]
